hook.text: After I pour my coffee, I will meditate for two minutes. Attaching new habits to old ones locks them in.

buildup.text: Habit stacking uses an existing routine as the cue for a new behavior. The old habit triggers the new one.

discovery.text: The formula: 'After [current habit], I will [new habit].' Specificity makes the cue unmissable.

twist.text: Stacking fails when the anchor habit is inconsistent. Build on something you already do reliably every day.

climax.text: Chain multiple small habits together. Over time, a morning routine builds itself one stack at a time.

punchline.text: Stack new habits on old ones. Piggyback to consistency.

quiz.question: What is the formula for habit stacking?
